en.purpose: To calculate APGAR score and make assessment.
en.use:
The Apgar score is used to assess the physical state of a neonate immediately after birth. It can be used in preterm and full term newborns.

The score also allows the assessment of the response of a neonate to resuscitation. Per Neonatal Resuscitation Program, scoring continues at 5 minute intervals until reaching a score of 7 or until 20 minutes of life is encountered.

Fill in all the 5 input fields which are- appearance/colour, pulse, grimace, activity/muscle tone, respirations- to receive a total score and interpretation. The interpretation is as follows:

>= 7 normal

>= 4 to <= 6 moderately abnormal

<= 3 critically low
en.misuse: Not to be used to predict individual risk of mortality and adverse neurologic outcome.

gt0001.description: Apgar is an acronym for Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration. The Apgar score is used as a simple, repeatable method to document the physical condition of every live newborn infant at 1 and 5 minutes after birth. The clinical score is derived from assessment of skin colour (Appearance), heart rate (Pulse), reflex irritability (Grimace), muscle tone (Activity) and respiratory effort (Respiration). Each of these 5 components has 3 grades- 0, 1, 2 with descriptions. 0 is the worst outcome and 2 is the best outcome for each component. The clinical score is further classified into 3 categories to give the final result of the Apgar assessment.

gt0003.description: The infant's breathing effort is observed and assigned an appropriate grade.

gt0004.description: The heart rate of the infant is checked and graded accordingly.

gt0005.description: The limb movements of the infant are observed and their quality is graded here.

gt0006.description: The infant's response to stimulation is graded in this field.

gt0007.description: The infant's skin colour is observed and graded which is a sign of efficient gas exchange and blood circulation.

gt0009.description: The sum of the 5 ordinal scores for each component parameter.

gt0011.description: The total score is classified into 3 categories to give the final APGAR assessment.

gt0012.description: The rule adds individual scores of all input fields to give a total score.
